Description: Fragment of lip and neck, with part of spool handle, of North Ionian black-figured pottery column-krater. Some traces of white slip, otherwise very worn. Interior glazed with two added red bands lined in white; maeander frieze between bands on top of rim, blobs on outside; exterior: much of underside of rim, handle and handle area glazed; in panel on neck, sphinx or siren facing right, wearing mob-cap and with alternate red and black wing feathers; various ill-preserved fill.
Curator's comments: From the same krater as 1924,1201.914. Pencil 'AP' (only?) on interior.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.500)
